1.text: Be you therefore followers of God, as dear children;

2.text: And walk in love, as Christ also has loved us, and has given himself for us an offering and a sacrifice to God for a sweet smelling smell.

3.text: But fornication, and all uncleanness, or covetousness, let it not be once named among you, as becomes saints;

4.text: Neither filthiness, nor foolish talking, nor jesting, which are not convenient: but rather giving of thanks.

5.text: For this you know, that no fornicator, nor unclean person, nor covetous man, who is an idolater, has any inheritance in the kingdom of Christ and of God.

6.text: Let no man deceive you with vain words: for because of these things comes the wrath of God on the children of disobedience.

7.text: Be not you therefore partakers with them.

8.text: For you were sometimes darkness, but now are you light in the Lord: walk as children of light:

9.text: (For the fruit of the Spirit is in all goodness and righteousness and truth;)

10.text: Proving what is acceptable to the Lord.

11.text: And have no fellowship with the unfruitful works of darkness, but rather reprove them.

12.text: For it is a shame even to speak of those things which are done of them in secret.

13.text: But all things that are reproved are made manifest by the light: for whatever does make manifest is light.

14.text: Why he said, Awake you that sleep, and arise from the dead, and Christ shall give you light.

15.text: See then that you walk circumspectly, not as fools, but as wise,

16.text: Redeeming the time, because the days are evil.

17.text: Why be you not unwise, but understanding what the will of the Lord is.

18.text: And be not drunk with wine, wherein is excess; but be filled with the Spirit;

19.text: Speaking to yourselves in psalms and hymns and spiritual songs, singing and making melody in your heart to the Lord;

20.text: Giving thanks always for all things to God and the Father in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ;

21.text: Submitting yourselves one to another in the fear of God.

22.text: Wives, submit yourselves to your own husbands, as to the Lord.

23.text: For the husband is the head of the wife, even as Christ is the head of the church: and he is the savior of the body.

24.text: Therefore as the church is subject to Christ, so let the wives be to their own husbands in every thing.

25.text: Husbands, love your wives, even as Christ also loved the church, and gave himself for it;

26.text: That he might sanctify and cleanse it with the washing of water by the word,

27.text: That he might present it to himself a glorious church, not having spot, or wrinkle, or any such thing; but that it should be holy and without blemish.

28.text: So ought men to love their wives as their own bodies. He that loves his wife loves himself.

29.text: For no man ever yet hated his own flesh; but nourishes and cherishes it, even as the Lord the church:

30.text: For we are members of his body, of his flesh, and of his bones.

31.text: For this cause shall a man leave his father and mother, and shall be joined to his wife, and they two shall be one flesh.

32.text: This is a great mystery: but I speak concerning Christ and the church.

33.text: Nevertheless let every one of you in particular so love his wife even as himself; and the wife see that she reverence her husband.
